translation: O Krishna, please completely dispel this doubt of mine, for it is not possible for anyone but You to do so.
commentary: 6.39 This this? Me my? doubt doubt? Krishna O Krishna? to cut to dispel? Arhasi oughtest? Infinitely completely? Tvat than Thou? Another another? of doubt of doubt? of this of this? Chhetta dispeller? Not not? Hi verily? Uppadyate is fit.Commentary There can be no better teacher than Thee for Thou art the omniscient Lord. Thou alone canst dispel this doubt. A Rishi (seer)? a Deva (god)? or a Muni (sage) will not be able to destroy this doubt.
